importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game in which Shohei Ohtani delivered an historic two-way performance, marking the Dodgers' clinching of the NLCS and their return to the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame encompasses the NLCS Game 4 victory and the immediate transition to the World Series, highlighting the postseason momentum and implications for the 2025 MLB season.

keyTakeAways: Shohei Ohtani delivered an unprecedented two-way performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, hitting three home runs and striking out 10 batters while pitching shutout ball into the seventh inning.
The Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS, becoming only the fifth team to sweep a best-of-seven series in postseason history and the first since Washington in 2019.
Ohtani's performance earned him NLCS MVP honors and is widely considered one of the greatest individual postseason performances in baseball history.
The Dodgers are returning to the World Series for the fifth time in nine seasons and are aiming to become the first repeat champions since the New York Yankees in 1998–2000.
The Brewers, who led the majors with 97 wins, were eliminated for the third time in their recent playoff run and have not appeared in the World Series since 1982.
The Dodgers' pitching staff combined to allow only two earned runs and 35 strikeouts over 28 2/3 innings, showcasing a dominant postseason rotation.
This victory marks the Dodgers' 23rd appearance in the World Series in franchise history and their first sweep of an NLCS since 2019.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Japanese-American professional baseball player, two-way star (pitcher and hitter)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic two-way performance in the NLCS, hitting three home runs and striking out 10 batters, earning NLCS MVP honors and cementing his legacy as one of the greatest postseason performers in MLB history.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball franchise based in Los Angeles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers won the NLCS with a sweeping 4-0 victory over the Brewers, clinching their spot in the World Series and becoming the first team to sweep an NLCS since 2019.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball franchise based in Milwaukee
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept in the NLCS by the Dodgers, marking their third elimination in recent playoff appearances and their first postseason loss in a best-of-seven series since 1982.

namedEntities.name: Dave Roberts
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Roberts praised Ohtani's performance as one of the greatest postseason games ever, highlighting the significance of the moment in team history and the momentum shift toward the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Dodgers player, former World Series MVP
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman described Ohtani's performance as 'absolutely incredible' and emphasized its historical impact on the team's postseason success and legacy.

namedEntities.name: Jose Quintana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Quintana started the game and was the first pitcher to face Ohtani in a postseason game, where Ohtani hit a leadoff homer off him — a rare and historic feat.

namedEntities.name: Roki Sasaki
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Dodgers relief pitcher and rookie closer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Sasaki pitched the ninth inning in the final game of the NLCS, securing the win in a successful relief appearance.

namedEntities.name: Mookie Betts
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Betts contributed to the scoring with a single in the first inning, helping the Dodgers score off Ohtani’s first homer.

namedEntities.name: Will Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Smith scored off a single in the first inning, adding to the Dodgers' early lead in the game.

namedEntities.name: Jackson Chourio
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Chourio recorded the Brewers' first hit of the game, but was stranded by Ohtani’s defensive and offensive dominance.

namedEntities.name: Blake Perkins
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Perkins acknowledged that the Brewers’ offense failed in the NLCS despite having a strong regular season, citing poor hitting against the Dodgers’ rotation.

namedEntities.name: Pat Murphy
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Murphy praised Ohtani's performance as one of the greatest individual performances in postseason history, citing his power and strikeout totals.

namedEntities.name: Alex Vesia
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vesia escaped a jam in the seventh inning, allowing Ohtani to return to the field and hit his third home run.

namedEntities.name: Caleb Durbin
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Durbin scored a run in the eighth inning, contributing to the final run in the Dodgers' 5-1 victory.

namedEntities.name: Brice Turang
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Turang reached base on a grounder that allowed a run to score, contributing to the final scoring in the eighth inning.

namedEntities.name: Anthony Banda
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Banda ended the eighth inning by grounding out, sealing the final run in the game.

namedEntities.name: Blake Treinen
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Treinen allowed two baserunners in the eighth inning, marking a key moment in the Dodgers' defensive struggles during the game.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shohei Ohtani delivered a historic two-way performance in Game 4 of the 2025 National League Championship Series, hitting three home runs and striking out 10 batters while pitching shutout ball into the seventh inning. The Los Angeles Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the series, becoming only the fifth team to sweep an NLCS and the first since 2019. Ohtani's performance, including a leadoff homer off Brewers starter Jose Quintana and a 469-foot drive that cleared a pavilion roof, earned him NLCS MVP honors and is widely hailed as one of the greatest individual postseason games in baseball history. The Dodgers return to the World Series for the fifth time in nine seasons, aiming to become the first repeat champions since the New York Yankees in 1998–2000. The Brewers, who led the majors with 97 wins, were eliminated for the third time in their recent playoff run and have not appeared in the World Series since 1982.
title: Shohei Ohtani hits 3 homers and strikes out 10 in Dodgers' clinching 5-1 NLCS win over Brewers
